text: Pinocchio is a fictional character from the 1883 book The Adventures of Pinocchio by Carlo Collodi. Pinocchio is a puppet, made by wood carver, Geppetto. When he tells lies, his nose gets longer. Pinocchio learns about being a real life boy and wants to be a real human being instead of a puppet made of wood and strings. The most well-known and beloved version of the story is the 1940 animated Disney movie Pinocchio. The other two most famous and beloved versions and adaptations of the story are from the Mexican Guillermo Del Toro and the Italian Giuliano Cenci. ==Other websites== Category:Characters in written fiction
title: Pinocchio
